Our liberal arts education prepares you for life. You gain the knowledge and insight that employers and graduate schools are looking for. So you’ll graduate ready for whatever comes next.
It’s no secret we have amazing, homemade food. You'll love our legendary Saint A's burger and Egg Saint A's! Which is why "The Princeton Review" ranks us #15 in the nation for best campus food.
jobs and internships through career center
We're committed to helping you find internships and jobs. In fact, our Career Development Center is dedicated to assisting you in developing a plan for post-graduate success.
That’s how many hours we volunteered last year. We believe in giving and serving. Which is why "The Princeton Review" has named us 5th in the nation for students engaged in community service.
Our small classes mean your professors will actually know you. They’ll be dedicated to your success and work to help you reach your goals. Does it get any better than that?
In the past 50 years, every U.S. President, and nearly every candidate, has debated or spoken here. Our New Hampshire Institute of Politics is a critical campaign stop.
We think every voice in the classroom should be heard. It makes for better debates and more interesting discussions. Our small classes are more personal with individual attention.

We're in the NCAA Division II Northeast-10 Conference. Our student athletes bring a spirit of competition to the field, ice, court, and course. Be a part of our tradition of hard work, discipline, and respect.
Over 125 years ago, we opened our doors to students of every religion, status, and ethnicity. Today, we’re still opening doors as the third-oldest Catholic college in New England.
That’s enough space for over 60 buildings, two quads, an ice arena, sports fields, and a pond. With lots of room to roam, you won’t run out of things to do on campus.
Campus is full of people who like to sing, dance, debate, ski, and play chess. Whatever you like to do, we’ve got a club for it. If we don’t, you can start your own.
We award $63 million in total aid to our students each year. We’ll help you secure the funds you need to finance your education. So you can focus on your studies, not your finances.

Center for Ethics in Business & Governance

Choosing the right college is not a decision to take lightly. At Saint Anselm, we understand the needs of prospective students during this time of exploration and our Office of Admission is here to help. With 46 majors, 51 minors, and 6 pre-professional programs offered, there is something for everyone. Whether you are technically minded, artistically gifted, politically inspired or socially conscious, Saint Anselm College will feel like your home.
Congratulations on being admitted to Saint Anselm College. Now that you’re in, find out what’s next!
Founded by the Order of Saint Benedict
© 2020 Saint Anselm College. All rights reserved.
Center for Ethics in Business & Governance
If you are considering Saint Anselm College, there is no better way to find out if the college is the right fit than to

. Each year, we welcome prospective students and their guests from all over to come and learn more about our academic programs and admission policies, meet community members, explore campus, and experience what it means to be an Anselmian.
We offer a variety of visit opportunities to best suit your needs. If you have any questions, please call the Office of Admission at (603) 641-7500. We look forward to having you on campus!
The college will be closed on the following days:
Monday, January 20 (Martin Luther King Jr. Day)
We offer many different visit opportunities throughout the year. Our

is available to schedule a date and time that is convenient for you. Though you are welcome to walk-in for any scheduled tour or information session, we recommend registering ahead of time. Please note that interviews, transfer talks, and special group visits must be scheduled ahead of time by registering online.

Information sessions are led by an Admission Counselor with a current student. They will be followed by a student-led tour of campus. Information sessions are recommended for first-time visitors to Saint Anselm College. An overview of the Anselmian community and the admission process is provided, followed by a tour of campus.
An Information Session and Tour is approximately 2 hours.
We invite you to take a student-led tour of campus. This is an excellent opportunity to explore some of our academic spaces, residence halls, dining options, and more.
Campus tours are approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes in length.

Informational interviews are conducted by an Admission Counselor or a trained Admission Student Leader. They are approximately 30 minutes in length, including a brief meeting with family members in attendance. All scheduled interviews include an optional tour of campus, which will be conducted upon conclusion of the interview.
Interviews are reserved for candidates interested in applying for fall 2020 admission or transfer students.

Transfer Talks allow interested students to discuss the transfer process via a one-on-one meeting with our Coordinator for Transfer Admission, Tony Trodella. These 30-minute sessions can be held on our beautiful campus or over the phone. On campus meetings can also be accompanied by a tour of campus.

Large groups from schools and organizations are welcome to request a Special Group Visit. We ask that groups do not exceed 60 people and that requests be made for high school-aged students only. To best accommodate your visit, requests should be made at least two weeks prior to your desired visit date.
If you have questions regarding special group visits, please contact

Apply to College - Dates and Deadlines
Apply to College - Dates and Deadlines

Saint Anselm seeks students ready to learn more about themselves and the world. We welcome people who are ready to contribute positively to our community through academics, student activities, athletics, and/or community service. Applying to college is exciting, but we know the process can be overwhelming. To assist you through this important process, our Office of Admission is here to help every step of the way. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to
To determine your specific application requirements, please select the type of applicant that best fits your needs:
(High School Students, Homeschooled Students, U.S. Dual Citizens, U.S. Permanent Residents, U.S. Citizens Studying Abroad)
(Please note that nursing applicants must apply either Early Action or Early Decision)

Below are the admission and financial aid deadlines you need to meet on your way to becoming a Saint Anselm student. If you have any questions regarding these deadlines, please feel free to contact the
For more information regarding our Admission process, visit our
For more information on Financial Aid, visit our
You will be notified of a decision earlier than applicants applying regular decision. If admitted, you are not required to attend Saint Anselm College.
*If applying Early Action, notification of financial aid offers will be made beginning February 1 for those families who apply for financial aid by the December 1 priority deadline.

You will be notified of a decision earlier than all other applicants. Along with your application, you must sign an early decision contract, acknowledging that upon admission, you will attend Saint Anselm College and will withdraw all other applications.
Students interested in applying to our Nursing program must apply either Early Action (Non-binding, November 15) or Early Decision (Binding, December 1).
All nursing applicants must submit their SATs or ACTs for full consideration. More information regarding the requirements for nursing can be found in our

*If applying Early Action, notification of financial aid offers will be made beginning February 1 for those families who apply for financial aid by the December 1 priority deadline. Students who apply Early Decision and submit their financial aid materials by December 1 will receive their financial aid offer with their offer of admission, by January 1.
You will be notified of a decision by mid-March. If admitted, you are not required to attend Saint Anselm College.

If you are interested in enrolling for the spring semester you should submit your application by November 15. Decisions will be mailed on a rolling basis. If you are interested in on-campus housing, it is strongly suggested that you apply by November 15, as housing is not guaranteed. There is no option to apply early decision or early action for the spring semester.

If you are a transfer student interested in enrolling for the fall semester you should submit your application by April 1. Decisions will be mailed on a rolling basis. If you are interested in on-campus housing, it is strongly suggested that you apply by April 1, as housing is not guaranteed.

We are eager to assist you during your college selection process. Whether you have just begun your college search or you are making your final decision, we look forward to partnering with you and your family.
Each member of our admission staff works with and is responsible for students from specific geographic areas across the country and around the world.
so that you may connect with them and ask them any questions.
